speaker: Dungeon Master & NPCs

speaker: Magnus Burnsides
lines: Travis McElroy

speaker: Merle Highchurch

speaker: Taako
lines: Justin McElroy

speaker: Episode 1.5
lines: Here There Be Gerblins -

speaker: Announcer
lines: Strap on your fantasy seatbelts and brace your asses for… THE ADVENTURE ZONE!

speaker: [Theme music
lines: Déjà Vu by Mort Garson]

speaker: Griffin
lines: So, well, let’s talk about the classes we’re playing. So, we’re only playing with three people, which is tiny, it’s pitiful. Based on—

speaker: Travis
lines: We’re gonna get just demolished.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, you’re gonna get wrecked. I’ll be dungeon mastering, which I’ve never done. I actually did it once, for a pickup game.

speaker: Justin
lines: [Quietly] Tell that to Nirvana.

speaker: Griffin
lines: What am I telling to Nirvana?

speaker: Justin
lines: [Laughing] That three people is tiny.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Sure. But you—you guys will be facing the horrors that I throw at you, and you’ll be playing… I think we’re keeping it pretty traditional, yeah?

speaker: Travis
lines: Yep.

speaker: Griffin
lines: We got, uh… Travis, you’re gonna be a fighter.

speaker: Travis
lines: I’m playing a human fighter named Magnus Burnsides.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I love that. Magnus… Burnsides?

speaker: Travis
lines: Correct.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Is he, uh… Is he, I mean, Magnus. Is that— is that Greco-Roman in nature? Is he— is he real historical fantasy? What’s the deal?

speaker: Travis
lines: [Sarcastically] Yes, Magnus Burnsides is a real person that I based this on.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Justin
lines: Uh, I’m— I’m playing a wizard.

speaker: Griffin
lines: ‘Kay.

speaker: Justin
lines: His name is spelled “T-A-A-K-O”.

speaker: Travis
lines: So like “tay… tay-ko?”

speaker: Griffin
lines: So like “tayko…”

speaker: Justin
lines: “Tahk”… Well, I mean, the… It’s two A’s so…

speaker: Griffin
lines: Is your wizard named… Are you naming your goddamn wizard “Taco”?

speaker: Travis
lines: His name is Taako.

speaker: Justin
lines: [Laughing] It’s a family name, it’s not pronounced like—

speaker: Griffin
lines: [Also laughing] Is it short for something?

speaker: Travis
lines: Taco Bell?

speaker: Clint
lines: He’s actually, he’s actually “Taako the Lesser.”

speaker: Justin
lines: My father, Taako the Great.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Taakobel.

speaker: Travis
lines: Taako Supreme.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Please, please, can it be Taakobel.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, I live in a cabana. I guess it’s okay, Justin, because like, in the infinite world of fantasy I’m about to craft for you, maybe tacos don’t exist already. And it’s just a nutrition in the traditional sense. The taco is not realized. It doesn’t mean anything.

speaker: Justin
lines: Oh my god my, my whole goal… My goal for this adventure is for to invent the taco.

speaker: Griffin
lines: [Laughing] Sure!

speaker: Clint
lines: Roll for salsa.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You might… You might need to roll for salsa. I don’t

speaker: know. It… You could take any number of checks. It could take a peppers check, a sauce check, a consistency check—
Justin
lines: A zesty— a zesty check?

speaker: Griffin
lines: A zestiness check.

speaker: Justin
lines: A freshness check?

speaker: Travis
lines: A soft or hard shell check.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I love it.

speaker: Justin
lines: Picante check?

speaker: Griffin
lines: I— I’m going to be so deep in-game that your name’s not even gonna be ridiculous. What is a taco?

speaker: Justin
lines: Roll for zestiness.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Roll for going and thinking outside the bun. Daddy, what do you, uh… You’re a cleric, right?

speaker: Clint
lines: I made… I’m a dwarf cleric—

speaker: Griffin
lines: ‘Kay.

speaker: Clint
lines: —named Merle Highchurch.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Merle?

speaker: Clint
lines: And that’s “M-E-R-L-E.”

speaker: Griffin
lines: See, that’s a goddamn name.

speaker: Clint
lines: Yeah!

speaker: Travis
lines: I’m sorry— Magnus Burnsides?

speaker: Griffin
lines: No no no, Magnus is a great name. I’m saying all three… I’m saying we’re batting a thousand here. With three great names.

speaker: Travis
lines: Justin, what was your race?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Including Taako.

speaker: Justin
lines: Uh, white.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Why does it matter? No, it does actually matter. For— there are statistical implications.

speaker: Justin
lines: High elf. I’m a high elf.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, terrific. Do you have a last name, Taako?

speaker: Clint
lines: Supreme?

speaker: Travis
lines: The Wizard.

speaker: Griffin
lines: No, for… I’ll give you Taako, I’ll let you—

speaker: Justin
lines: It’s actually, it’s actually Taako again, but spelled differently.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Taako Tacco.

speaker: Clint
lines: T-A-C-C-O.

speaker: Justin
lines: I do have a last name, but it’s a secret that will only be revealed later in the adventure.

speaker: Clint
lines: That’s power!

speaker: Griffin
lines: I love it. So Merle, Taako, and Magnus.

speaker: Travis
lines: I have a special skill called Rustic Hospitality, which means um—

speaker: Justin
lines: So we’re on a team with Paula Deen.

speaker: Travis
lines: Which means I make really great gravy—

speaker: Griffin
lines: [Southern grandmotherly voice] “Come on in sugar! Come on! Come on in to the Burnside Estate.”

speaker: Travis
lines: And the Rustic Hospitality means that, “Because I come from the ranks of common folk, you fit among them with ease, you can find a place to hide, rest or recuperate among other commoners unless you have shown yourself to be a danger to them. They shield you from the law or anyone else searching for you, although they are unwilling to risk their lives for you.”

speaker: Griffin
lines: So poor people love Magnus, is what you’re saying.

speaker: Travis
lines: That is correct.

speaker: Griffin
lines: He’s uh—

speaker: Justin
lines: He’s the Larry The Cable Guy of our team!

speaker: Griffin
lines: He’s the Cheetos of people.

speaker: Travis
lines: Listen, I reach out to real America, real America loves Magnus, they don’t get Taako—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Well, real Faerûn or Forgotten Realms or wherever the hell we are.

speaker: Travis
lines: Real Faerûn, you know the real down home Faerûn, they love me.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Travis
lines: Uh, couple other special things, my flaw is that the tyrant that I stopped will stop at nothing to see my end—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Oh, shit—

speaker: Travis
lines: I believe in fairness, no one is above the law.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah yeah yeah.

speaker: Travis
lines: And if someone is in trouble I will stop at nothing to help them, and thinking is for other people, I’m all about action.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay you’re, you’re lawful, I’m assuming?

speaker: Travis
lines: Lawful good.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Lawful good, okay, sounds good.

speaker: Justin
lines: Uh I got, Taako’s a wizard.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yep, I—

speaker: Justin
lines: I got, spellcasting abilities—

speaker: Griffin
lines: You didn’t even… I mean that was redundant to— I assumed that your wizard was capable of—

speaker: Justin
lines: [Laughing] I have a book that I can look at to get, to just relax a little bit and just get, get back in my zone.

speaker: Griffin
lines: [Laughing] What is the book?

speaker: Justin
lines: What?

speaker: Griffin
lines: What, is it The Secret? Is it—

speaker: Justin
lines: It’s— no it’s a book that I carry around with me, it’s uh, The Seven Habits of Highly Effective People.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Fantastic.

speaker: Justin
lines: Like a family tome—

speaker: Travis
lines: Taako needs a minute—

speaker: Justin
lines: It’s a record of my life’s work so far, The Seven Habits of Highly Effective Elves, and I carry it around with me, and it helps me—

speaker: Griffin
lines: [Still laughing] What are the, can I ask, what are two of the habits? I imagine “looking at trees” is one of them.

speaker: Justin
lines: Yeah, “long hair,” that is one—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Managing your flaxen ‘do— okay I think I get it—

speaker: Clint
lines: Hacky-sack, don’t forget hacky-sack.

speaker: Justin
lines: Yeah, hacky-sack.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Is that, is that flavor? Or does that have, does that have a mechanical context?

speaker: Justin
lines: Yep, it does have a mechanical effect, I can rest once per day and recover expended spell slots.

speaker: Justin
lines: So… I also can see in the dark.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Oh, you have darkvision?

speaker: Justin
lines: Yeah, I can see in the dark, just like it’s bright light, um, I can only see shades of gray, though.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Hm.

speaker: Clint
lines: Oh wow, 50 of ‘em.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Ain’t that the way.

speaker: Justin
lines: Yeah, 50 whole shades. I can have an advantage of saving throws against being charmed?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Justin
lines: And magic can’t put me to sleep.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Except, oh, that is— What a curse! You can’t use your own sleeping spell on yourself to get those good Z’s. Maybe you’re taking a trip tomorrow and you’re nervous—

speaker: Justin
lines: Actually elves don’t sleep, Griffin. You should know that. They meditate deeply.

speaker: Griffin
lines: … Fantastic.

speaker: Justin
lines: Yeah, and I got a Shelter of the Faithful, so I’m a servant of Omec.

speaker: Travis
lines: Nope!

speaker: Justin
lines: “I command the respect of those who share my faith and I can perform the rites of Omec, and you and your companions,” that’s you guys, “can expect to receive free healing and care at a temple, shrine or other established presence of Omec’s faith.”

speaker: Griffin
lines: Your divine patron is called Ogma, not Omec. He’s like an actual guy. He’s the god of knowledge—

speaker: Justin
lines: Well, he’s not an actual guy, Griffin, how deep in are you, buddy?

speaker: Griffin
lines: I’m pretty deep—

speaker: Justin
lines: He’s made up for the game.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I’m pretty deep in. But you’re a wizard! I was confused by this at first, because you’re a wizard, which you typically don’t really think of them as especially devout people, but this is a god of wizardly shit.

speaker: Clint
lines: Merle is a hill dwarf. [Clint will later retcon this and say Merle is a “beach dwarf.”] Neutral good, used to be a soldier, he was a mercenary soldier.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Clint
lines: But the life was just too hard on him. Comes from a big family. All with names like… Nundro Rockseeker, Gundren and Tharden.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah yeah, sure.

speaker: Clint
lines: He was not asked to go along with the dwarves in any of the Hobbit movies, and he’s kinda pissed about that.

speaker: Travis
lines: Mhm.

speaker: Clint
lines: Cleric. His domain is affiliated with… Marthammor Duin—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Oh shit.

speaker: Clint
lines: The dwarf god of wanderers, travelers, and outcasts.

speaker: Travis
lines: [Stage whispering] Psst, Dad, the interesting stuff is on the front of the page.

speaker: Clint
lines: Oh! Sorry! Ah, let’s see, he’s a lot of fun at parties, he’s a good dancer, he has that smile that just makes you want to talk about yourself.

speaker: Griffin
lines: What is his party skill? How hard does he party? You may not have—

speaker: Clint
lines: He parties like it’s 1999.

speaker: Justin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Roll to— he has ONE-THOUSAND NINE-HUNDRED AND NINETY-NINE party points?

speaker: Clint
lines: What is a party point?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Why do we even need to play?

speaker: Clint
lines: What is a party point?!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Dad already won Dungeons and Dragons with his pre-rolled, broken character! Then I think we’re— I think we’re more more or less good to go… I guess just as sort of an overview of how Dungeons and Dragons works, because Dad, you’re literally starting from scratch here. You can see all over your sheet you have different modifiers. Different numbers, different stats, the basic mechanic of Dungeons and Dragons is you say what you wanna do, if it’s something like “I’m going to attack that person,” that’s pretty easy, you just roll your 20-sided die, and then you add a relevant modifier to it, and if it beats their armor, you hit ‘em. That is— That’s sort of the basic idea of Dungeons and Dragons, if you wanna get more creative with it, then there are rules in place that will help me sort of interpret your action and make it something that happens in the game. But almost always it’s going to be roll a d20, you add a modifier to it, and then if it beats a target then you, you can… you can do it. And you did it, and I’m proud of you.

speaker: Clint
lines: Cool.

speaker: Justin
lines: Griffin, one other question, there’s a little box that says “Equipment,” is that the stuff that I have right now?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, you have those things.

speaker: Justin
lines: …’kay.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Did you not like your equipment, do you need to go shopping?

speaker: Justin
lines: No, it’s all fine… there’s nothing about clothes in here but I figure I’ll have ‘em.

speaker: Griffin
lines: [Laughing] No you’re actually… no you’re all actually—

speaker: Travis
lines: No, it says “set of common clothes” at the bottom!

speaker: Griffin
lines: No, sorry, I’m taking that away from you now. A dragon comes and bites all your clothes off.

speaker: Travis
lines: Wait, I like where this game is going. And then what happens?

speaker: Justin
lines: “Hello, my name is Taako and this is my dick, can I come into your town?”

speaker: Griffin
lines: “I can save it—”

speaker: Clint
lines: “Got some gold?”

speaker: Griffin
lines: “I can save it from goblins and stuff.”

speaker: Travis
lines: Um, I also, I forgot to mention that I, uh, also rolled for a trinket when creating my character—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Oh boy.

speaker: Travis
lines: And so I have a knife that belonged to a relative.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Like a butter knife?

speaker: Travis
lines: It’s like a pocket knife. It’s like a, Swiss Army knife, it’s got a toothpick in it, uh—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Is it like a +8 knife? That you’re not actually—

speaker: Travis
lines: Well the only description it says is—

speaker: Griffin
lines: You roll like five d10s on a hit—

speaker: Travis
lines: When you make your character, you can roll once on the trinkets table to gain a trinket, “A simple item, lightly touched by mystery.”

speaker: Griffin
lines: No. It’s not lightly touched by killer magic though. I’m gonna say it’s a shitty knife.

speaker: Travis
lines: No, I don’t think my thing has any magic in it so much as it’s just a tiny—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, well thanks for stopping the flow of the podcast to let us know that you have a shitty knife.

speaker: Travis
lines: It’s gonna come back into play! I think as we build the story and the character, my tiny knife will come back into play—

speaker: Justin
lines: [Still laughing] I’m gonna force him to sell it, to pawn his peepum’s knife to buy me out of jail or something.

speaker: Griffin
lines: If a fucking— if a fucking skeleton rips your arms off, you’re not gonna be like “But then, a dragon comes out of my knife and it was there the whole time and he loves me.” That’s not how, that’s not—

speaker: Travis
lines: “And then he sews my arms back on!”

speaker: Griffin
lines: So our story actually starts with the three of you— and, you guys can establish, if you want, how Magnus and Taako and Merle know each other.

speaker: Travis
lines: Craigslist.

speaker: Griffin
lines: [Laughing] Craigslist—

speaker: Justin
lines: Which is actually— which is actually a list that a gnome named Craig puts up on a tree every day.

speaker: Griffin
lines: At a tavern, perhaps, uh—

speaker: Justin
lines: [In a high voice] “Wanna make friends? Join my list!”

speaker: Justin
lines: “Pen thy name here!”

speaker: Griffin
lines: [In same voice] “M for M, I’ve got a huge… I’ve got a hungry butt! A hungry butt over here, looking for a young stud, a young dryad,” [regular voice] Oh, fantastic.

speaker: Justin
lines: “Any of you dryads down to clown?”

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, so you find each other on Craigslist, maybe you’ve been doing some odd jobs around. So the three of you have done a few jobs together, probably. Over drinks one night with Merle’s cousin, whose name is, shit, his name is Gundren Rockseeker— who I assumed is just named that so you know from the start here, that we are now playing Dungeons and Dragons.

speaker: Travis
lines: His name is Steve Smith.

speaker: Griffin
lines: His name… these names are uh, outta control. I may eventually shed the booklet I’m going out of? Which I’m really hoping you guys didn’t read, because I bought all of you starter kits, and you could’ve just cheated and read ahead in this adventure. Gundren Rockseeker comes to you guys in a bar. Maybe you’ve had a few drinks, maybe not, I don’t wanna make assumptions. Maybe you’re all straight-edge. Maybe you don’t like to party.

speaker: Travis
lines: Magnus has had about six ciders.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Six? Um?

speaker: Travis
lines: But he can— no he can hold his own. It’s pretty weak as apple ciders go, like 3.2.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Regular apple ciders or virgin? We know that Merle possesses nearly 2,000 party points, so he’s— I imagine he’s been crushing it.

speaker: Justin
lines: He’s the Andrew W.K. of D&D.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You’re right. Over cider he talks to you guys about an exciting opportunity. He seems pretty straight-laced. He seems like he’s not giving you no bullshit, and he promises, in a low Dwarven grumble, which I’m not going to do, that—

speaker: Justin
lines: Do it, or I walk.

speaker: Travis
lines: Griffin, it’s not fun if you don’t do the voices.

speaker: Justin
lines: Seriously, I’m gonna do a voice.

speaker: Clint
lines: [Deep grumble] Come on, do the voice, Griffin.

speaker: Griffin
lines: [Unintelligible grumbling] Ehh [Normal voice] He says that in a—

speaker: Clint
lines: There you go.

speaker: Travis
lines: No wait, hold on!

speaker: Griffin
lines: No that’s just— that’s how he sounds, you are interpreting these low grunts [sickly groan] basically Slingblade.

speaker: Travis
lines: “French-fried taters”

speaker: Clint
lines: “I’m glad we’re gonna go looking for rocks.”

speaker: Griffin
lines: You interpret from his Slingblade-esque grunts that he has to offer you what he calls the last job you’ll ever need to take. He basically wants to audition you, to see if you are capable of handling—

speaker: Travis
lines: So is this like a two contrasting monologues or?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, yeah, he wants one that shows excitement, one that shows impotent rage. No, he wants a—

speaker: Clint
lines: And a two-minute song.

speaker: Griffin
lines: He was thinking more along the lines of slaying. Protecting. Guidance.

speaker: Justin
lines: Ah, got it.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Adventuring, essentially.

speaker: Justin
lines: [proto Taako voice nasally and crisp] Excellent.

speaker: Griffin
lines: So he has asked the three of you to escort a supply wagon from the town of Neverwinter, where the three of you are currently held up, to the town of Phandalin. It’s about a two, three day ride on a uh, on a wagon.

speaker: Travis
lines: Is he expecting trouble?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, no. Not really.

speaker: Clint
lines: Well he’s gonna get it!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Well, you don’t—

speaker: Travis
lines: No, he’s giving us the job.

speaker: Griffin
lines: He’s giving you a job right now.

speaker: Clint
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Travis
lines: Listen—

speaker: Clint
lines: Not a good employee.

speaker: Travis
lines: —listen up, Merle.

speaker: Griffin
lines: He has asked you, basically, to transport a wagon full of goods, maybe a few of his personal effects—

speaker: Travis
lines: Mhm.

speaker: Griffin
lines: —from Neverwinter to Phandalin.

speaker: Clint
lines: Great.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh. And it sounds like a pretty easy job, but you never know—

speaker: Justin
lines: Can I ask a question?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, please.

speaker: Justin
lines: Is this entire adventure dictated through exposition, or—

speaker: Griffin
lines: No no no, we’re gonna get—

speaker: Justin
lines: —or right now.

speaker: Griffin
lines: This is, this is stage-setting.

speaker: Justin
lines: Is this a game— is Dungeons & Dragons listening to you do exposition?

speaker: Griffin
lines: No. Not for the most part.

speaker: Justin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I got— this is me planting the seed. I’ve actually already planted the seed, and now I have to cover it in soil and nurture it for a bit. And then it’s gonna, I’m just gonna blow on it and that’s it.

speaker: Justin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Travis
lines: I do know Justin, from my limited amount, what always makes D&D better is questioning how long it’s taking.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Clint
lines: Is he, is he along with us, is it just the three of us?

speaker: Griffin
lines: So, Gundren is actually going up ahead of you guys.

speaker: Clint
lines: Okay.

speaker: Griffin
lines: With a fighter escort, named Sildar Hallwinter, whom you’ve never met, he was not actually at the tavern last night.

speaker: Clint
lines: Mixer?

speaker: Griffin
lines: [Laughing] He was not at the wine mixer, where you guys uh—

speaker: Travis
lines: And his name one more time?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, Sildar Hallwinter.

speaker: Justin
lines: Eugh.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Um. Yeah.

speaker: Travis
lines: It sounds disgusting.

speaker: Clint
lines: I’m just gonna call him Silly.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Barry… Barry Bluejeans. Uh.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I can call— that’s what I'm saying—

speaker: Travis
lines: Griffin—

speaker: Griffin
lines: This is our game, we can do whatever we want. I can start calling these creeps Barry Bluejeans, and, uh—

speaker: Clint
lines: You’re good.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Justin
lines: [Laughing] Did I bring the ingredients to create, what people of our world—

speaker: Justin
lines: —would refer to as a taco?

speaker: Griffin
lines: There’s a problem, there’s no cultured milk at this point in the world.

speaker: Justin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You’re gonna have a hard time with a soured cream.

speaker: Justin
lines: Alright.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Once you can crack that fucking riddle man—

speaker: Griffin
lines: —I’ll give it to you.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I will shower you with riches. As the taco magnate.

speaker: Clint
lines: Cast—

speaker: Justin
lines: Okay, got it.

speaker: Clint
lines: —cast Lactose Intolerant.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You have this oxen-led wagon. You can establish where you guys are on this wagon, maybe one of you is keeping a lookout from the rear? Maybe one of you is riding on top like Teen Wolf?

speaker: Justin
lines: I’m in the— I’m in the back with the goods.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Travis
lines: And I’m driving.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Are you getting high on your own supply? Are you maybe eating an apple? Maybe eating an apple you shouldn’t be eating?

speaker: Justin
lines: No. Not yet.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. Alright. Travis, you’re driving the oxen, you said?

speaker: Travis
lines: Yes.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Travis
lines: With my vehicle proficiency, I am driving quite well.

speaker: Griffin
lines: [Laughing] I don’t know how to interpret vehicle proficiency—

speaker: Travis
lines: Everyone is very impressed with how well I’m driving—

speaker: Griffin
lines: I’m not gonna— you’re not gonna hit a fucking ramp—

speaker: Griffin
lines: —with your oxen.

speaker: Travis
lines: [Laughing] Listen, if we gotta get away from Boss Hogg, I’m the guy you want at the front of the wagon.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, sure he does. Uh, Merle? Where are you, what are you doing? What’s your seat?

speaker: Clint
lines: I am probably studying my cantrips.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. Just prioritizing—

speaker: Travis
lines: Just say masturbating, dad.

speaker: Clint
lines: I’m deep in thought—

speaker: Travis
lines: “Don’t come in Mom, I’m studying my cantrips!”

speaker: Clint
lines: —‘cause something about this whole thing stinks to me. I’ve never liked Gundren—

speaker: Griffin
lines: [Laughing] I, uh—

speaker: Clint
lines: —and I think there’s something up.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I guess, I guess like, why can’t he do both? Why can’t he masturbate and also cast Ethereal Light onto things?

speaker: Clint
lines: I don’t see a roll for that.

speaker: Travis
lines: [Giggling] Roll to masturbate! Let’s do it!

speaker: Clint
lines: Sleight of hand! Sleight of hand, maybe?

speaker: Griffin
lines: So as you’re traveling a few… say about 30, 40 miles out from Phandalin? I want you all to make a perception check, your proficiency bonus plays a hand in a lot of rolls that you make.

speaker: Justin
lines: I got a, uh, eight.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Eight total?

speaker: Justin
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And Merle?

speaker: Clint
lines: Pshew. Wow. Uh… six.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And what’d you get, Travis?

speaker: Travis
lines: I got a crit 20, so that’s 23?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Twenty-three. Okay. You see the shit out of everything.

speaker: Travis
lines: Mhm.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Travis, you see about 200 feet up— lying in the road two figures that with your incredible perception check, you can actually tell, with your eagle eyes, that they are two dead horses lying in the middle of the road.

speaker: Travis
lines: Seems fine. [Laughing] Nothing seems strange at all.

speaker: Griffin
lines: As the driver of the wagon, you can I guess decide—

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah, I’m gonna stop the wagon.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. You bring it to a stop, about 200 feet out—

speaker: Travis
lines: And I motion silently, to get the attention of Merle and Taako, and  kinda pull them up towards the front of the wagon.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. You have a few moments there where you warn them that shit has gone south. I’ll use that same perception check, you notice a few figures crouching in a part of the shaded wood, sort of off to the side of the road.

speaker: Travis
lines: Do they seem to have noticed us? Like are we in bright sunlight?

speaker: Griffin
lines: They have actually noticed you, and two of them are charging your wagon as you speak. So because you notice them, they did not get a surprise round on you, which would have been very, very bad. But I do need all of you to roll initiative.

speaker: Travis
lines: Yay!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Then I will roll for the gorblins, here, that are storming you. I’m gonna start you out with gorblins because it seems like comfortable territory. You guys are familiar with the concept of a goblin. So it’s my first time ever doing this. Oh, they rolled a critical miss! So they are going to go last, I assume.

speaker: Justin
lines: How many are there?

speaker: Griffin
lines: There are three, two of them are rushing the group, one is pretty heavily obscured by the brush, probably about 40 feet out, sort of between you and the horses laying in the middle of the road. So yeah, the goblins are getting… they got pretty close, before this fight started. They moved, before anybody moves or takes any actions, we will start at the top of the order, which is Dad. Merle.

speaker: Justin
lines: Are we definitely sure that these are bad guys?

speaker: Griffin
lines: They have weapons drawn and are rushing at your cart.

speaker: Travis
lines: [Laughing] And saying “Welcome!”

speaker: Justin
lines: Would it— would it spend like a turn if Dad was like, “Whoa whoa whoa kemosabes— You cool? Hey, you cool?”

speaker: Travis
lines: I— Most of the time, just kinda general rule of thumb… when your DM tells you to roll for initiative, you’re in combat.

speaker: Justin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You’re in combat, but, but! You can, as a free action, you can speak. So you could cast Light, or Sacred Flame, or Thaumaturgy— Sacred Flame is really your combat cantrip. If you wanted to do that.

speaker: Clint
lines: But it’s not a buff, right?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Or you could get— No, it is a debuff, in the sense that you set their asses on fire.

speaker: Clint
lines: Alright. I’ll—

speaker: Griffin
lines: That is, yeah. Or you could run up to them and smash them with your warhammer.

speaker: Travis
lines: And we’re still above them, right, because we’re on the cart?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh—

speaker: Travis
lines: They’re on the ground?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Travis, you are sort of in the saddle, driving the cart— all three of you are sort of towards the front of the cart, where Magnus summoned you up to, to warn you, “Hey, dead horses.” So you are all basically towards the front of the cart and could easily hop down, it’s not especially high up.

speaker: Griffin
lines: A 10, plus two is 12, so—

speaker: Justin
lines: Griffin, it says in the spell description here that the target has to succeed on a dexterity saving throw.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Right, that is what they’re attempting to do—

speaker: Justin
lines: Okay, right, right, got it.

speaker: Griffin
lines: They rolled a 12, so they barely miss— so you roll 1d8, you roll the eight-sided die, and that will establish how much damage they take.

speaker: Clint
lines: Okay. [To Justin] Is this…?

speaker: Justin
lines: [Checking the die] Yeah… is it?

speaker: Clint
lines: [Quietly] Yeah, yeah, okay—

speaker: Travis
lines: It’s the one that doesn’t have any numbers higher than eight.

speaker: Clint
lines: I rolled a six!

speaker: Griffin
lines: That is pretty— That’s very very good. So you attack, you launch some fire onto the goblin closest to the wagon, and with that, he looks, like, upon death’s door. And the other goblin that you can see, the one that’s not in the brush somewhere, just sorta stops in his tracks and is like “Aww, shit.” And that is… where he’s at. Next in order is Justin.

speaker: Travis
lines: Blast that one in the brush!

speaker: Justin
lines: I’m gonna… How far away is the one in the brush, Griffin?

speaker: Griffin
lines: The one out in the brush is about 40 feet out.

speaker: Justin
lines: Okay, now, question.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Justin
lines: Do I see the one in the brush?

speaker: Griffin
lines: You actually do not. Travis is the one who spotted him.

speaker: Travis
lines: Oh okay.

speaker: Justin
lines: Um—

speaker: Griffin
lines: You can search for the, you know, sort of the general direction. If you tried to cast a spell at him right now you’d have Disadvantage. Because you don’t exactly know where he is. If you wanna do a perception check it would take up your turn, but you could get a pretty good idea of where this person is.

speaker: Justin
lines: No, I’m gonna blast the one that Merle hit, with a Ray of Frost.

speaker: Griffin
lines: A popular— popular skill.

speaker: Justin
lines: Thank you.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Break off Ray of Frost for me, what’s it do?

speaker: Justin
lines: It’s “A frigid beam of blue-white light streaks towards a creature within range. You make a ranged spell attack against the target—”

speaker: Griffin
lines: Gotcha.

speaker: Clint
lines: Whoa!

speaker: Justin
lines: So, that’s a 24.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Holy shit, yeah you blast that thing. And you were attacking the one that Merle just hit? Or the one Merle hasn’t—

speaker: Justin
lines: The one Merle just hit, yes.

speaker: Clint
lines: Hey, at least you put him out, he was on fire.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, uh, you gotta roll your damage now, which is…

speaker: Justin
lines: It’s a d8.

speaker: Clint
lines: Nice!

speaker: Justin
lines: Uhh, six.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You don’t add anything to that, it’s just—

speaker: Justin
lines: Right.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. You freeze him instantly, you flash freeze him, and he sort of topples to the ground and shatters.

speaker: Justin
lines: Yeah! It’s our first kill!

speaker: Clint
lines: Yeah!

speaker: Griffin
lines: It’s your first kill!

speaker: Justin
lines: So, why am I so horny?

speaker: Justin
lines: I’m broken inside!

speaker: Griffin
lines: It’s the horrible thing, if you had talked to them you would have realized that they’re part of a Hug Committee. They were running forward to hug you, to give you a hug.

speaker: Travis
lines: I’m gonna jump off the cart and try to kinda— so I can swing my battle-axe double handed if I haven’t drawn my shield yet off my back—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, but keep in mind that your armor’s going to be lower as a result of that.

speaker: Travis
lines: Yes.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay!

speaker: Travis
lines: I have to do that. But for right now I’m going to jump off the cart and try and come down on top of him, swinging my battle-axe two handed.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. What does that mean—

speaker: Travis
lines: Which I assume grants me advantage.

speaker: Griffin
lines: If you do a leaping strike from the wagon, down… down onto the domepiece of this—

speaker: Travis
lines: Mhm.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Of this goblin, is what you’re telling me.

speaker: Travis
lines: That’s what I’m trying to do.

speaker: Griffin
lines: The goblin is probably about 15 to 20 feet away from you, he’s not right next to the wagon so that’s a, that’s a—

speaker: Travis
lines: [Laughing] Well, Magnus has a vertical leap of 18 feet.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I’m gonna make you— I’ll let you do it, but you have to make a very low athletics check. If you’re just jumping, that’s athletics.

speaker: Travis
lines: Terrific, I have +5 athletics.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Alright, we’ll say you need to beat a—

speaker: Travis
lines: So that’s 16.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah that’ll do. That’ll do pig—

speaker: Travis
lines: Great.

speaker: Griffin
lines: So you are allowed to make this stupid attack that you’re making.

speaker: Travis
lines: So, doing the battle-axe two handed means my damage is 1d10 instead of 1d8—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, but you have to actually roll the attack.

speaker: Travis
lines: Yes, I realize this—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. And you have advantage, so you can roll 2d20.

speaker: Travis
lines: Great. So I rolled a 20 right there, so I’ll roll again—

speaker: Griffin
lines: You rolled a crit?!

speaker: Travis
lines: No—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Travis
lines: It was a 15 plus five, and then a nine, so I— a 20, was my highest—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, yeah, that’ll— that’ll do it.

speaker: Travis
lines: And I’m gonna roll 1d10… is that this one? Yeah…So that’s 10 plus three, 13.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You rolled max damage.

speaker: Travis
lines: Yes.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You cut the thing in half, longways. You cut the thing in half—

speaker: Travis
lines: The knave to the chops.

speaker: Griffin
lines: In like the direction that, if you had your choice, you would least like to be cut in half, I would say.

speaker: Travis
lines: Got it.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You have— the least survivable halving that could possibly be conceived. So the other goblin that’s out in the brush pops up, almost like “Yeah, guys, get ‘em— Oh no, no God no—” he sees—

speaker: Travis
lines: [Laughing] “Not my friends!”

speaker: Griffin
lines: He sees— he says

speaker: Gerblin
lines: Wait, I thought there were only two gerblins out there, why are there— why are there three over there OH JESUS, JERRY NO.

speaker: Travis
lines: “He just had a kid!”

speaker: Griffin
lines: He is uh…

speaker: Travis
lines: “Oh Jerry…”

speaker: Griffin
lines: He is horrified, and draws a… what does he draw… draws a short bow and takes an arrow out of his quiver, and seems to fidget with it for a bit. And then you see him light the arrow on fire, and—

speaker: Travis and Justin
lines: Aww.

speaker: Griffin
lines: —launch it—

speaker: Justin
lines: Crap.

speaker: Griffin
lines: —in the direction of… we’ll say Magnus? Um. Since you are actually— actually, who’s still on the wagon?

speaker: Travis
lines: Both of them are still on the wagon.

speaker: Justin
lines: Merle and Taako are still on.

speaker: Travis
lines: I fell off the wagon.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Let’s see.. Let’s say he launches it at Taako. So he makes a ranged attack. He rolls a five plus five, which is…

speaker: Justin
lines: [Whispering] Ten. It’s 10.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, I’m sorry, plus four. Five plus four is nine, which I assume is not gonna do it. Doesn’t do it.

speaker: Travis
lines: So Justin, that would be against your armor class, which is 12.

speaker: Griffin
lines: That would be against your armor class. What is your AC, Juice?

speaker: Justin
lines: Twelve.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah. So nine doesn’t cut it, it sort of twangs into the side of the canvas of the wagon instead.

speaker: Travis
lines: Oh no! Is it setting our— is it setting our canvas on fire?

speaker: Griffin
lines: It has actually begun to set the canvas on fire, and it almost seems like he’s satisfied with that result? And as you guys are distracted by the flames, he turns around and starts to hoof it. His speed is 30 feet, so he gets pretty good distance into the the cl— the brush.

speaker: Clint
lines: Uh. I’m going to leave the fire up to somebody else.

speaker: Clint
lines: And throw my handaxe—

speaker: Griffin
lines: You need to— you’re gonna move in the direction of…?

speaker: Clint
lines: Can I move before I throw?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, yeah yeah sure, you can— you can split your movement up, you can move however you want—

speaker: Clint
lines: All right—

speaker: Griffin
lines: You can move 10 feet and then do your attack and do the rest—

speaker: Clint
lines: Alright I have a maximum of 25 feet. So I’m gonna move—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, so from the wagon you get about half distance to where he is, you are throwing your handaxe into some brush, so he’s gonna have partial cover. Which basically means—

speaker: Clint
lines: Okay.

speaker: Griffin
lines: His AC is going to be improved. His armor class is already pretty decent, so you need to um— you need to roll real well.

speaker: Clint
lines: What am I rolling?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, so on your paper, in the little thing in the middle there there should be a handaxe thing, and that’ll tell you what your mod is.

speaker: Travis
lines: So roll a d20.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Roll a d20, you’re gonna add…

speaker: Clint
lines: Okay… Fourteen and I add four so that’s 18.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Eighteen? He would’ve had 17 with that cover so yes, you just barely, you throw it into the woods, you can’t exactly see— you see like a, branches rustling, and you throw your axe in that direction and you hear

speaker: Gerblin
lines: AH!

speaker: Griffin
lines: And, so you know you probably connected and got some meat in there, so roll 1d6 plus two, and that’s your damage.

speaker: Justin
lines: [Quietly, checking which is the d6] Yep.

speaker: Clint
lines: Okay. It’s a six, plus two

speaker: Clint
lines: …is eight.

speaker: Griffin
lines: After you hear that “AH!” you don't hear anything, ever again, from that guy.

speaker: Griffin
lines: The horses are covered in, well not covered, they have a few obviously mortal holes in ‘em. Arrow holes, you recognize them as. But somebody’s taken the arrows back, a very prudent archer—

speaker: Clint
lines: They’re dead? They’re not asleep?

speaker: Travis
lines: Ooh, by the way, can I take that short bow from that dude so I can actually have a ranged weapon?

speaker: Griffin
lines: You can, it’s not great. So yeah, you got these two horses, they are… they are dead as shit. There are a few empty bags and containers lying around…

speaker: Justin
lines: Are they cold?

speaker: Griffin
lines: The horses?

speaker: Justin
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Griffin
lines: They are actually a little bit warm. This was not a— this did not happen last night, as soon as they left. You assume maybe they made camp after leaving the tavern last night, and… this may have happened within a matter of hours. And, in fact, why don’t you guys make an investigation check, if you want.

speaker: Travis
lines: I rolled a two. I can’t find my own butthole.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You’re like, “Wow,” you’re like, “Look at these big dead dogs.”

speaker: Travis
lines: I could see it from far away, and then I knew nothing about it.

speaker: Justin
lines: Alright, 17.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Seventeen investigation, okay. Merle?

speaker: Clint
lines: What do I add to it, Justin?

speaker: Justin
lines: Uh, the investigation number. Next to investigation.

speaker: Clint
lines: Oh okay, so I rolled an 11.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. Merle and uh, Magnus, you are sort of clueless, you notice the horses—

speaker: Travis
lines: [Exaggerated surprise] Horses?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Justin, among the containers, you notice an empty map container. Maybe a tube that a roll of parchment could be secured inside— what you might ship a poster in, but fantasy like. Which you actually recognize from the tavern last night as something that Gundren did have on him.

speaker: [The group follows drag marks in the dirt] to the mouth of a cave that a sort of natural stream is flowing out of. Pretty wide stream, not especially deep—
Travis
lines: Is it beautiful?

speaker: Griffin
lines: It’s the most goddamn beautiful thing you’ve ever seen.

speaker: Travis
lines: Hmm, that’s nice.

speaker: Griffin
lines: It is— All of you get 20 points of inspiration just from seeing it, you are deeply inspired…

speaker: Justin
lines: Yes!

speaker: Griffin
lines: No, you don’t get that.

speaker: Justin
lines: Aw, crap.

speaker: Griffin
lines: It’s the mouth of a cave. Along sort of the stream, you can sort of see into the cave a little ways. You can see basically— The cave is comprised of a path along the right side of the mouth of the cave that leads in alongside of the stream. but Dad, you can cast Light for free since it’s a cantrip, onto—

speaker: Clint
lines: Okay.

speaker: Griffin
lines: —maybe a nice stick that you found on the ground and give that to a fighter who can’t see super great in the under-earth.

speaker: Clint
lines: Is— Travis, is your weapon one-handed or two-handed?

speaker: Travis
lines: It is either, it is versatile.

speaker: Clint
lines: Okay, so I could give you a torch and you’d still be able to use your weapon.

speaker: Travis
lines: You could also just cast Light on my axe.

speaker: Griffin
lines: That— that might look bitching.

speaker: Clint
lines: Alright, let’s go with the bitching effect of casting Light on your axe.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, [Boosh]. Travis now has this—

speaker: Clint
lines: What do I do, do I roll?

speaker: Griffin
lines: No, that’s fine. You’re not attacking his axe.

speaker: Griffin
lines: “Take this, you bastard. I hate you, axe!” Not too far into the cavern, you feel the path branch off to the right— I guess you see it ‘cause you have this beautiful light axe. And in fact, as you sort of get within distance of that entrance, that the light of your axe from your, the light from your bitching axe, pours into it, you hear rustling in there, you hear the sound of metal sort of clinking together almost like a chain being moved, lifted off the ground—

speaker: Travis
lines: Listen, Magnus—

speaker: Clint
lines: Like a Jacob Marley kind of rustling!

speaker: Travis
lines: Magnus believes that thinking is for other people, and I tend towards action, so I’m going down that chain hallway.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I like that, I am actually going to give you a point of Inspiration for that.

speaker: Travis
lines: So I head down the hallway, towards the chains.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay… do the two of you follow him? Or are you more just…

speaker: Justin
lines: Yeah, Taako chills.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Taako just kind of chills.

speaker: Travis
lines: Because I think there’s a chance that maybe Sildar [Barry] and Gundren are chained up down there.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Oh, listen to that.

speaker: Clint
lines: Okay, I guess I follow them.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. Well, well, Taako is actually—

speaker: Justin
lines: I am chilling, there is no them to follow.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Taako’s on team hang out.

speaker: Travis
lines: Well, I only go about 25 feet, like I’m not gonna get too far away, I’m just gonna—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Well, no we’re not in combat, so you… there’s no order, so.

speaker: Travis
lines: Okay, well, I don’t wanna get too far away from them, so— listen,  I’m foolhardy, but I’m not stupid.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, you’re not—

speaker: Travis
lines: So I’m gonna go down the hall the 60 feet that they can still see me and I can still see back.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. You space yourself out a little bit, and you just sort of turn the corner into this cavern, and sort of wave your axe around, hoping to cast some light on the things that you see in there. Inside, you see a decent sized cavern, [with some stalagmites] and coming out of them are these big metal rods, connected to chains, connected to wolves. Three wolves…

speaker: Travis
lines: Kill the light, kill the light, kill the light!

speaker: Griffin
lines: They’re not, like growling. They’re not— they don’t seem especially violent right now.

speaker: Clint
lines: Aww

speaker: Travis
lines: I actually have animal handling skill pretty good.

speaker: Clint
lines: Well of course you do.

speaker: Travis
lines: I do! My… My folk hero nature— I’m a farmer. …Carpenter.

speaker: Clint
lines: What’s your animal handling? What is your animal handling…

speaker: Travis
lines: Plus three.

speaker: Clint
lines: Well so’s mine.

speaker: Travis
lines: Okay, well, fuck you.

speaker: Clint
lines: Every father wants to hear that from his son.

speaker: Travis
lines: I’m gonna, I’m gonna, uh…

speaker: Griffin
lines: You’re not his father right now, are you? You’re his adventuring companion.

speaker: Clint
lines: Oh, that’s right.

speaker: Travis
lines: I’m going to cautiously but confidently approach the wolves.

speaker: Griffin
lines: If anything is more important, when you’re dealing with wolves, you gotta be confident, ‘cause they can smell that on you.

speaker: Travis
lines: Exactly, I don’t wanna appear weak, because their— the predator-prey behavior is gonna kick in. Listen, I know about animals.

speaker: Griffin
lines: With every passing step that you draw closer to them, they seem more agitated. Couple of them are snarling at you now.

speaker: Travis
lines: So there’s some wolves down there, it doesn’t seem like it’s worth it, let’s keep going.

speaker: Taako
lines: Excellent, well, I trust your judgement.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, I’m into that.

speaker: Clint
lines: Off we go.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I’m into that— yeah, sure. Alright, so you can continue down the cave. It’s getting very dark, basically the natural light that was coming in from the mouth of the cave is… it was providing quite a bit, so you can see until now basically, and now you need your light axe, your maglight, to really get around. Merle and Taako… I almost forgot your name, impossibly. You are… you don’t need it. You don’t— you can see basically just fine down here.

speaker: Merle, you actually see up ahead the outline of a overhead bridge, an overpass that is— that is suspended in the air, it’s connected to two entrances on the second story level. It looks like it’s connecting two passageways higher up in the cave, a second story of this cave. You also see the outline of a figure sitting on top of the bridge.
Justin
lines: I’ll uh, call out to him.

speaker: Taako
lines: Hello, friend!

speaker: Griffin
lines: You’re using Common I’m assuming to do that?

speaker: Justin
lines: No, Elvish.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Oh. Elvish…

speaker: Travis
lines: [Laughs] Just in case there’s some underground elves.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You hear a questioning grunt, like “Huh?” and then—

speaker: Justin
lines: I try again in—

speaker: Magnus
lines: No! Shh shh shh!

speaker: Travis
lines: Shut the fuck up—

speaker: Justin
lines: I try again in Goblin!

speaker: Griffin
lines: You try to get a— You don’t know Goblin, so you kind of yell—

speaker: Justin
lines: Yes I do, it’s one of my languages.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Is it really?

speaker: Justin
lines: I know Common, Elvish, Draconic, Dwarvish, and Goblin.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, what do you yell?

speaker: Taako
lines: Hello, friend!

speaker: Gerblin
lines: Who’s there?

speaker: Taako
lines: Hail and well met!

speaker: Gerblin
lines: I… you don’t sound like, uh, anybody I know.

speaker: Taako
lines: We’re just exploring, we’ve taken a wrong turn.

speaker: Gerblin
lines: You certainly have. I would actually heartily recommend you turn around, this is not a great place for tourism.

speaker: Taako
lines: Where have we found ourselves?

speaker: Griffin
lines: He does not know how to handle that situation.

speaker: Gerblin
lines: Come a li’l bit closer, show yourself to me.

speaker: Taako
lines: Come closer? Did you say?

speaker: Gerblin
lines: Come closer to the overpass.

speaker: Travis
lines: This is a good time, if you’ve got any illusion magic.

speaker: Taako
lines: I will warn you, we’re very dangerous, though we mean you no harm. I would not suggest launching an attack on us.

speaker: Gerblin
lines: How dangerous are you— how dangerous we talking?

speaker: Taako
lines: Level… Level 1.

speaker: Merle
lines: Go ask the goblin cut in half how dangerous we are!

speaker: Gerblin
lines: You cut— You cut a goblin in half?!

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah, but he wasn’t cool like you—

speaker: Taako
lines: Oh, excellent, excellently— well played, I was just trying to establish a rapport.

speaker: Travis
lines: Now to be fair, to be fair— Merle doesn’t speak Goblin, and neither do I.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Justin
lines: Oh, that’s right.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You just hear “Blar blar blar blar blar.”

speaker: Taako
lines: So… Do you have gold? In here?

speaker: Gerblin
lines: Sorry?

speaker: Travis
lines: Bold. Bold question.

speaker: Taako
lines: Sorry, sorry… Where are we?

speaker: Gerblin
lines: You’re in our— you’re in our hideout… you’re making me extremely uncomfortable, I don’t know who you are, what you’re doing.

speaker: Travis
lines: Hey Dungeon Master—

speaker: Gerblin
lines: We recently got new recruits, but, like, seeing you is certainly part of the interview process.

speaker: Clint
lines: Tell him we’re looking for Gun—

speaker: Travis
lines: Dungeon master—

speaker: Taako
lines: My name… My name is Taako. A friend of ours was taken, and his horses were killed. We’re searching for our friend.

speaker: Gerblin
lines: Ooh shit, yeah, we… did that. Hey, guys! Someone’s here! Guys, it’s the guys from the horse thing!

speaker: Travis
lines: Use Mage Hand! Use Mage Hand, push him off!

speaker: Griffin
lines: I need the three of you—

speaker: Justin
lines: Wait, how close— how close am I, Griffin?

speaker: Griffin
lines: You are— you managed to get about 20 feet in there, but as he yells, he readies his weapons, so go ahead and roll initiative.

speaker: Okay. So you have this one goblin on the overpass, and after his word of warning, nobody’s really rushed to his aid. Either by the two entrances the overpass connects, or from the depths of the cave that you’re facing. You do hear, in the distance down the length of the cave, an extremely loud racket. You hear voices saying something — Taako, you can understand as one of them says — two voices talking. You hear one say “Really?” and the other says “You heard ‘em.” And then you hear a banging, almost like, um… somebody’s hitting something against something else? You can’t exactly, unless you see it, you can’t really tell what the— what the noise is, but you hear a pretty terrible sound coming from down there. And top of the order is Magnus.
Travis
lines: So, I am gonna hole up in that— they’re coming from behind us?

speaker: Griffin
lines: They are coming from— nobody’s coming, you can’t really determine— the voices you heard are actually coming from in front of you. Behind the overpass, the overpass is in front of you. Behind that is deeper.

speaker: Travis
lines: Okay, great. I’m gonna post up and move to in front of that overpass— the entrance in the overpass. I’m gonna ready an action.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Where are you… Where are you moving, underneath the bridge?

speaker: Travis
lines: I’m moving to the opening, wherever it is that the voices are coming from. I wanna be ready for whoever’s coming.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, so you sort of position yourself in front of— you move under the underpass to the other side, waiting for whatever’s coming down.

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah, and I’m gonna ready an attack action.

speaker: Griffin
lines: For what? If something—

speaker: Travis
lines: The first person to come down that hallway.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You’re just gonna melee attack them.

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay!

speaker: Clint
lines: I’m gonna cast Shield of Faith…

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Clint
lines: —around— around Magnus.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. Can you explain what that does?

speaker: Clint
lines: Uh, Shield of Faith, “A shimmering field appears and surrounds a creature of your choice within range, granting it a +2 bonus to AC for the duration.”

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Travis
lines: Baller.

speaker: Clint
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And… are you gonna move or do anything else? I guess that’s your action.

speaker: Clint
lines: That was my action.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, Travis, you have +2 to AC.

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And Dad… I think you just expended one of your spell slots.

speaker: Clint
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, cool. Then the order moves to the goblin on the overpass. He sees you put a magic beautiful shield around this already heavily shielded fighter in the front, so he sort of turns his attention off of Magnus. He’s pretty sure he can’t penetrate all that, and he’s actually going to aim at Merle with a shortbow, and he rolls a… Ooh, Jesus, a 21 versus AC. What’s your armor class?

speaker: Clint
lines: Eighteen.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Eighteen, so 21 beats your 18, so he hits you. A four.

speaker: Clint
lines: Okay.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Four plus two, so six piercing damage.

speaker: Clint
lines: Okay.

speaker: Griffin
lines: The goblin on the bridge?

speaker: Justin
lines: [Crosstalk] The one that’s 20 feet away from me.

speaker: Clint
lines: [Crosstalk] The one up on the overpass?

speaker: Justin
lines: The overpass goblin.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Clint
lines: Ooh.

speaker: Justin
lines: Ooh, 24.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Twenty-four? That is a hit.

speaker: Justin
lines: We got… eight damage!

speaker: Clint
lines: Nice!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Eight damage… he takes all of that. It sort of knocks him back a little bit, but he maintains his footing on the overpass. He looks like he’s about to kick it. He looks real bad. So that is the end of the round. From the back of the hallway that Travis just ran up very valiantly to defend, you hear [creaking noise, crashing noise], almost like something has just fallen over, and then immediately after that, you hear the… The telltale sound of rushing water.

speaker: Travis
lines: Great. I’m gonna head back…

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Travis
lines: To where my buddies is. And then I’m gonna shoot the little goblin with my short bow.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Umm… okay.

speaker: Travis
lines: Unless there’s something else I can do.

speaker: Griffin
lines: No! You’re— you’re just gonna sort of stand there?

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah, um, 23.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Twenty-three, that is a hit.

speaker: Travis
lines: Okay, great. And then, d6, plus three, five.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You hit him square in the chest, and he says

speaker: Gerblin
lines: Wow, you guys weren’t kidding.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And then he falls off the, the bridge. Limply. Into the stream.

speaker: Travis
lines: Does there seem to be any way to get up to the overpass level?

speaker: Griffin
lines: I mean, you can climb.

speaker: Travis
lines: Well then, let’s climb.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Well, you are… already acted. Merle can—

speaker: Clint
lines: Alright, I will climb— I will climb. What do I need to do?

speaker: Griffin
lines: You will make a—

speaker: Clint
lines: I’m gonna try to climb up, to the overpass.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. To climb, you make an athletics check. To basically scale up the wall. You’re not climbing that high, and there is like a rocky craggy surface, so—

speaker: Clint
lines: Okay.

speaker: Griffin
lines: It’s not an especially difficult check, actually, to get up there. The bridge is relatively rickety, it’s of goblin construction, so it’s not amazing, but it looks like it’ll hold your weight.

speaker: Clint
lines: Okay. So I roll a 20-sided die?

speaker: Griffin
lines: You roll a 20-sided die, and you add your athletics.

speaker: Clint
lines: All right… I rolled a three, so my athletics is four, that makes it seven.

speaker: Griffin
lines: That is not… sufficient. You start to climb up the rocks, they’re a little bit wet from the moisture in here. You slip off— you don’t take any damage ‘cause you’re probably only a few feet up, and you’re not a very tall person, so I mean, that is a significant distance, but you do land on your ass. And you’re embarrassed. You take 10 embarrassment points.

speaker: Clint
lines: [Muffled] Ow.

speaker: Travis
lines: [Laughing] You take 10 psychic damage.

speaker: Clint
lines: And I— I peed a little. [Quieter] I peed a little.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. You peed a little bit. You might be advanced in years, maybe you pee a little bit every time you take any damage.

speaker: Taako
lines: I will attempt the same climb that felled my friend Merle.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Taako
lines: I have no athletics, here we go.

speaker: Justin
lines: Four, fourteen.

speaker: Griffin
lines: What’d you roll?

speaker: Clint
lines: Fourteen!

speaker: Justin
lines: Fourteen.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Fourteen, that’ll do it.

speaker: Taako
lines: Oh, luck of the, lucky— first timer’s luck, huh?

speaker: Griffin
lines: You scurry up the rocks, and you… you manage to climb on top of this bridge. You feel it sway, and shake a little bit underneath you as you get up there, but it holds fast. Suddenly, a horrifying wave of water, a wall of water, comes hurtling down the cave. Basically blasts into our heroes that are on the ground level. First, it hits Magnus, and then shortly thereafter collides with Merle, who is still on his ass. It starts to sweep you away. However, you both are sort of close to the craggy cave wall. So you can make a dexterity saving throw to try and not get flushed by this wall of water that’s rushing at you.

speaker: Travis
lines: I got a 13.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You got 13 total? Merle?

speaker: Travis
lines: Yep.

speaker: Clint
lines: I got a 16.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay! So both of you manage to grab onto the wall just as this wave of water hits you, and tries to pull you away, unsuccessfully. There was a lot of water though. So you are sort of having to fight against the stream, holding onto these rocks. So I need you both to also make a strength saving throw, to make sure that you can hold onto this rock. The whole time, Taako, you’re just sort of watching this charade, take place from your safe perch.

speaker: Justin
lines: Laugh—

speaker: Travis
lines: I got a thirtee—

speaker: Griffin
lines: You’re not laughing, but you are amused to see how it goes.

speaker: Travis
lines: I got a 13.

speaker: Clint
lines: I got seven.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Both of you get flushed. In the torrent of water.

speaker: Travis
lines: Oh, no.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You weren’t really, like hit by the wave of force that this thing brought with it at first, but you are dragged down the cave back into, sort of the first antechamber. So you both took three damage.

speaker: Clint
lines: [To himself] I’m down to two.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And that is the end of combat—

speaker: Taako
lines: I’m fine!

speaker: Taako
lines: Don’t worry about me!

speaker: Merle
lines: [Yelling from a distance] You okay, Taako?

speaker: Taako
lines: I’m fine! Don’t worry about Taako!

speaker: Travis
lines: But that was the end, now that the water is past.

speaker: Griffin
lines: That’s the end, yeah. That was the end, you are out of combat. You actually hear, Taako, from down the cavern, in Goblin. You are primed to hear this, Taako… the other two are sort of too far away, and also they don’t speak Goblin, so they wouldn’t hear it but. You hear

speaker: Gerblin
lines: Did we get ‘em?

speaker: Travis
lines: Answer in Goblin, Taako.

speaker: Taako
lines: [Laughing] N— No!

speaker: Travis
lines: No, no, yes! Tell him yes!

speaker: Clint
lines: Tell him yes! Tell him yes!

speaker: Taako
lines: Oh, sorry, let me try again— Yes!

speaker: Gerblin
lines: Which one is it, make up your mind!

speaker: Taako
lines: No, we definitely got them!

speaker: Gerblin
lines: Oh, thank god. Should we come down there, or— is it, is it cool?

speaker: Clint
lines: No!

speaker: Taako
lines: No, I got—

speaker: Gerblin
lines: Is it— Do their drowned bodies look kinda cool?

speaker: Clint
lines: Tell ‘em it’s a— tell ‘em there’s water everywhere, it’s freezing here—

speaker: Taako
lines: I got too horny from the killing, and I— I’m jerking o—

speaker: Gerblin
lines: Aw, Jesus, not again. We’re actually gonna— stay up here, thanks though.

speaker: Taako
lines: Don’t come in! Don’t come in here, it’s private!

speaker: Griffin
lines: You hear them shuffle off. You hear the sound of footsteps moving away from you. And you think that, using your clever ruse, you have scared them off.

speaker: Travis
lines: Yes… “ruse…”
